variable interval reinforcement
drug effects
horses

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Variable interval (VI) reinforcement scheduling is a specific type of operant conditioning that is sensitive to drug effects even when overt clinical signs of the drug have diminished. We conditioned six horses to break a light beam with a head-bobbing movement and reinforced this behavior with a reward of clean oats (approximately 30 mg/ reinforcement).
